001package imagingbook.pub.corners.subpixel;
002
003import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE;
004import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
005import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
006
007import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
008
009/**
010 * The common interface for all sub-pixel locators in this package.
011 * @see QuadraticTaylor
012 * @see QuadraticLeastSquares
013 * @see Quartic
014 * @author WB
015 * @version 2020/10/03
016 */
017public abstract class MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD {
018        
019        /**
020         * Tries to locate the sub-pixel maximum from the 9 discrete sample values
021         * (s0,...,s8) taken from a 3x3 neigborhood, arranged in the following order:
022         * <pre>
023         * s4 s3 s2
024         * s5 s0 s1
025         * s6 s7 s8
026         * </pre>
027         * The center value (s0) is assumed to be at position (0,0).
028         * @param s a vector containing 9 sample values in the order described above
029         * @return a 3-element array [x,y,z], with the estimated maximum position (x,y) and the associated max. value (z). 
030         * The position is relative to the center coordinate (0,0).
031         * {@code null} is returned if the maximum position could not be located.
032         */
033        public abstract float[] getMax(float[] s);
034        
035        /**
036         * Enumeration of keys for {@link MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD} methods.
037         */
038        public enum Method {
039                QuadraticTaylor, QuadraticLeastSquares, Quartic, None;
040        }
041        
042        /**
043         * Creates a specific {@link MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD} instance based on the supplied
044         * {@link Method} key.
045         * @param m the method
046         * @return a new {@link MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD} instance
047         */
048        public static MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD getInstance(Method m) {
049                MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD ml = null;
050                switch(m) {
051                case QuadraticTaylor:
052                        ml = new QuadraticTaylor(); break;
053                case QuadraticLeastSquares:
054                        ml = new QuadraticLeastSquares(); break;
055                case Quartic:
056                        ml = new Quartic(); break;
057                case None:
058                        break;
059                }
060                return ml;
061        }
062        
063        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        /**
066         * 2D interpolator using second-order Taylor expansion to fit a quadratic
067         * polynomial of the form
068         * <br>
069         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2  + c_5 xy
070         * <br>
071         * to the supplied samples values.
072         * @see MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD#getMax(float[])
073         */
074        public static class QuadraticTaylor extends MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD {
075                
076                private final double[] c = new double[6];       // polynomial coefficients
077
078                @Override
079                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
080                        c[0] = s[0];
081                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
082                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
083                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2*s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
084                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2*s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
085                        c[5] = (-s[2] + s[4] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
086                        
087                        double d = (4*c[3]*c[4] - sqr(c[5]));
088                        
089                        if (d < EPSILON_DOUBLE || c[3] >= 0) {  // not a maximum (minimum or saddle point)
090                                return null;
091                        }
092                        
093                        // max position:
094                        float x = (float) ((c[2]*c[5] - 2*c[1]*c[4]) / d);
095                        float y = (float) ((c[1]*c[5] - 2*c[2]*c[3]) / d);
096                        // max value:
097                        float z = (float) (c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y + c[5]*x*y);
098                        return new float[] {x, y, z};
099                }
100        }
101        
102        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
103        
104        /**
105         * 2D interpolator based on least-squares fitting a quadratic polynomial 
106         * <br>
107         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2  + c_5 xy
108         * <br>
109         * to the supplied sample values.
110         * @see MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD#getMax(float[])
111         */
112        public static class QuadraticLeastSquares extends MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD {
113                
114                private final double[] c = new double[6];       // polynomial coefficients
115
116                @Override
117                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
118                        c[0] = (5 * s[0] + 2 * s[1] - s[2] + 2 * s[3] - s[4] + 2 * s[5] - s[6] + 2 * s[7] - s[8]) / 9;
119                        c[1] = (s[1] + s[2] - s[4] - s[5] - s[6] + s[8]) / 6;
120                        c[2] = (-s[2] - s[3] - s[4] + s[6] + s[7] + s[8]) / 6;
121                        c[3] = (-2 * s[0] + s[1] + s[2] - 2 * s[3] + s[4] + s[5] + s[6] - 2 * s[7] + s[8]) / 6;
122                        c[4] = (-2 * s[0] - 2 * s[1] + s[2] + s[3] + s[4] - 2 * s[5] + s[6] + s[7] + s[8]) / 6;
123                        c[5] = (-s[2] + s[4] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
124                        
125                        //System.out.println("c = " + Matrix.toString(c));
126                        
127                        double d = (4*c[3]*c[4] - sqr(c[5]));
128                        
129                        if (d < EPSILON_DOUBLE || c[3] >= 0) {  // not a maximum (minimum or saddle point)
130                                return null;
131                        }
132                        
133                        // max position:
134                        float x = (float) ((c[2]*c[5] - 2*c[1]*c[4]) / d);
135                        float y = (float) ((c[1]*c[5] - 2*c[2]*c[3]) / d);
136                        // max value:
137                        float z = (float) (c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y + c[5]*x*y);
138                        return new float[] {x, y, z};
139                }
140        }
141        
142        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
143        
144        /**
145         * 2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial
146         * <br>
147         * f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2  
148         * <br>
149         * to the supplied sample values. The interpolation function passes through
150         * all sample values. The local maximum cannot be found in closed form but 
151         * is found iteratively, which is not guaranteed to succeed.
152         * @see MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD#getMax(float[])
153         */
154        public static class Quartic extends MaxLocator_NOTSOOLD {
155                static int DefaultMaxIterations = 20;   // iteration limit
156                static double DefaulMaxDelta = 1e-6;    // smallest x/y move to continue search 
157                static double DefaultMaxRad = 1.0;              // x/y search boundary (-xyLimit, +xyLimit)
158                
159                private final int maxIterations;
160                private final double maxDelta;
161                private final double maxRad;
162                
163                private final double[] c = new double[9];       // polynomial coefficients
164                
165                // -----------------------------------------------------------
166                
167                public Quartic() {
168                        this(DefaultMaxIterations, DefaulMaxDelta, DefaultMaxRad);
169                }
170                                
171                public Quartic(int maxIterations, double maxDelta, double maxRad) {
172                        this.maxIterations = maxIterations;
173                        this.maxDelta = maxDelta;
174                        this.maxRad = maxRad;
175                }
176                
177                @Override
178                public float[] getMax(float[] s) {
179                        c[0] = s[0];
180                        c[1] = (s[1] - s[5]) / 2;
181                        c[2] = (s[7] - s[3]) / 2;
182                        c[3] = (s[1] - 2 * s[0] + s[5]) / 2;
183                        c[4] = (s[3] - 2 * s[0] + s[7]) / 2;
184                        c[5] = (-s[2] + s[4] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
185                        c[6] = (-s[2] + 2 *s[3] - s[4] + s[6] - 2 * s[7] + s[8]) / 4;
186                        c[7] = (-2 * s[1] + s[2] - s[4] + 2 * s[5] - s[6] + s[8]) / 4;
187                        c[8] = s[0] + (-2 * s[1] + s[2] - 2 * s[3] + s[4] - 2 * s[5] + s[6] - 2 * s[7] + s[8]) / 4;
188                        
189                        // iteratively find the max location:
190                        boolean done = false;
191                        int n = 0;
192                        double[] xCur = {0, 0};
193                        double H00 = 0, H11 = 0, H01 = 0, d = 0;
194                        while (!done && n < maxIterations && Matrix.normL2(xCur) < maxRad) {
195                                double[] g = this.getGradient(xCur);
196                                double[][] H = this.getHessian(xCur);
197                                H00 = H[0][0];
198                                H11 = H[1][1];
199                                H01 = H[0][1];
200                                d = H00 * H11 - sqr(H01);
201                                if (isZero(d)) {
202                                        throw new RuntimeException(Quartic.class.getSimpleName() + ": zero determinant");
203                                }
204                                double[][] Hi = {                       // inverse Hessian
205                                                { H11 / d, -H01 / d}, 
206                                                {-H01 / d,  H00 / d}};  
207                                double[] xNext = Matrix.add(xCur, Matrix.multiply(Matrix.multiply(-1, Hi), g));
208                                if (Matrix.distL2(xCur, xNext) < maxDelta) {
209                                        done = true;
210                                }
211                                else {
212                                        xCur[0] = xNext[0];
213                                        xCur[1] = xNext[1];
214                                        n = n + 1;
215                                }
216                        }
217                        
218                        boolean isMax = (d > 0) && (H00 < 0);   // false if saddle point or relative minimum
219                        
220                        if (done && isMax) {
221                                float z = (float) getInterpolatedValue(xCur);
222                                return new float[] {(float) xCur[0], (float) xCur[1], z};
223                        }
224                        else {
225                                return null;
226                        }
227                }
228                
229                private double getInterpolatedValue(double[] X) {
230                        final double x = X[0];
231                        final double y = X[1];
232                        return c[0] + c[1]*x + c[2]*y + c[3]*x*x + c[4]*y*y
233                                                + c[5]*x*y + c[6]*x*x*y + c[7]*x*y*y + c[8]*x*x*y*y;
234                }
235                
236                private double[] getGradient(double[] X) {
237                        return this.getGradient(X[0], X[1]);
238                }
239
240                private double[] getGradient(double x, double y) {
241                        double gx = c[1] + 2*c[3]*x + c[5]*y + 2*c[6]*x*y + c[7]*y*y + 2*c[8]*x*y*y;
242                        double gy = c[2] + c[5]*x + 2*c[4]*y + 2*c[7]*x*y + c[6]*x*x + 2*c[8]*x*x*y;
243                        return new double[] {gx, gy};
244                }
245                
246                private double[][] getHessian(double[] X) {
247                        return this.getHessian(X[0], X[1]);
248                }
249                
250                private double[][] getHessian(double x, double y) {
251                        final double H00 = 2*(c[3] + y*(c[6] + c[8]*y));
252                        final double H11 = 2*(c[4] + x*(c[7] + c[8]*x));
253                        final double H01 = c[5] + 2*c[6]*x + 2*c[7]*y + 4*c[8]*x*y;
254                        double[][] Hi = {
255                                        { H00, H01}, 
256                                        { H01, H11}};
257                        return Hi;
258                }
259                
260        }
261}
